actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Roll Call 200
actions-list.actionItem: 2/3 Yea and Nay vote pending.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1339 — "To require the Federal Communications Commission to review certain rules of the Commission and develop recommendations for rule changes to promote precision agriculture, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 199).
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 198).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Ryan moved to recommit to the Committee on Ways and Means.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with two hours of debate on H.R. 2811.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2811 and H.J. Res. 39. Resolution provides for two hours of general debate on H.R. 2811 and one hour of general debate on H.J. Res. 39. The previous question is considered as ordered with one motion to recommit allowed on each measure.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 327. H.R. 2811 — "To provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 422
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 197).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1353 — "To direct the Federal Communications Commission to issue rules for the provision of emergency connectivity service, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 219
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 327
actions-list.actionItem: "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2811) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 39) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Commerce relating to "Procedures Covering Suspension of Liquidation, Duties and Estimated Duties in Accord With Presidential Proclamation 10414"."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was on the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 327, agreeing to H. Res. 327, if ordered, and the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1353, as amended.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 26.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 327, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on the resolution, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 327.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 327 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2811) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 39) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Commerce relating to "Procedures Covering Suspension of Liquidation, Duties and Estimated Duties in Accord With Presidential Proclamation 10414"."

Mr. Cole asked for unanimous consent that it be in order at any time on April 27, 2023 to consider H. Con. Res. 30 in the House if called up by the chair of the Committee on Foreign Affairs or his designee; that the concurrent resolution be considered as read; that the previous question be considered as read; that the previous question be considered as ordered on the concurrent resolution to adoption without intervening motion except for 80 minutes of debate with 20 minutes controlled by Representative McCaul of Texas, 20 minutes controlled by Representative Meeks of New York, and 40 minutes controlled by Representative Gaetz of Florida or their respective designees. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Kilmer to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 26.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jay Obernolte to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
